ci_support_linux_64_r_base4.4.yaml:
channel_sources:
- conda-forge
channel_targets:
- conda-forge main
cran_mirror:
- https://cran.r-project.org
docker_image:
- quay.io/condaforge/linux-anvil-x86_64:alma9
pin_run_as_build:
  r-base:
    min_pin: x.x
    max_pin: x.x
r_base:
- '4.4'
target_platform:
- linux-64

about.summary: This permutation based hypothesis test, suited for Gaussian and binary data, assesses the difference between two networks based on several invariance measures (e.g., network structure invariance, global strength invariance, edge invariance). Network structures are estimated with l1-regularized partial correlations (Gaussian data) or with l1-regularized logistic regression (eLasso, binary data). Suited for comparison of independent and dependent samples. For dependent samples, only supported for data of one group which is measured twice. See van Borkulo et al. (2017) <doi:10.13140/RG.2.2.29455.38569>.

This permutation based hypothesis test, suited for Gaussian and binary data, assesses the difference between two networks based on several invariance measures (e.g., network structure invariance, global strength invariance, edge invariance). Network structures are estimated with l1-regularized partial correlations (Gaussian data) or with l1-regularized logistic regression (eLasso, binary data). Suited for comparison of independent and dependent samples. For dependent samples, only supported for data of one group which is measured twice. See van Borkulo et al. (2017) <doi:10.13140/RG.2.2.29455.38569>.

name: r-networkcomparisontest
raw_meta_yaml:
{% set version = "2.2.3" %}
{% set posix = 'm2-' if win else '' %}

package:
  name: r-networkcomparisontest
  version: {{ version|replace("-", "_") }}

source:
  url:
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/NetworkComparisonTest_{{ version }}.tar.gz
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/Archive/NetworkComparisonTest/NetworkComparisonTest_{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: 14a60a2bb78043483638d44e035ce05d51437c5077433d55681266041445eced

build:
  number: 0
  noarch: generic
  rpaths:
    - lib/R/lib/
    - lib/

requirements:
  build:
    - {{ posix }}zip               # [win]
    - cross-r-base {{ r_base }}    # [build_platform != target_platform]
  host:
    - r-base
    - r-isingfit
    - r-matrix
    - r-networktools
    - r-qgraph
    - r-reshape2
  run:
    - r-base
    - r-isingfit
    - r-matrix
    - r-networktools
    - r-qgraph
    - r-reshape2

test:
  commands:
    - $R -e "library('NetworkComparisonTest')"           # [not win]
    - "\"%R%\" -e \"library('NetworkComparisonTest')\""  # [win]

about:
  home: https://CRAN.R-project.org/package=NetworkComparisonTest
  license: GPL-2.0-only
  summary: This permutation based hypothesis test, suited for Gaussian and binary data, assesses the difference between two networks based on several invariance measures (e.g., network structure invariance, global strength invariance, edge invariance). Network structures are estimated with l1-regularized partial 
    correlations (Gaussian data) or with l1-regularized logistic regression (eLasso, binary data). Suited for comparison of independent and dependent samples. For dependent samples, only supported for data of one group which is measured twice. See van Borkulo et al. (2017) <doi:10.13140/RG.2.2.29455.38569>.
  license_family: GPL2
  license_file:
    - '{{ environ["PREFIX"] }}/lib/R/share/licenses/GPL-2'

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - conda-forge/r
    - izahn
